segments.text: Are there many idioms in English ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: There are hundreds and hundreds.English is particularly rich in idiomatic expressions .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Can you give us an example ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'll look up the rate.To look up doesn't mean to look high into the sky or to look at the roof.It means to search for and find some information .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What about the expression goodbye ? Is that an idiom ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That is just a natural , grammatical English expression.It has a direct translation in other languages .
segments.speaker: S2
